item.title: A 10inch by 4ft pot hole outside of our main pedestrian gate at Charlton Park Academy, 24th September
item.description:
A pavement repair has worn away much quicker then the rest of the pavement due to inferior fill material. Mobility and wheelchair users have fallen into the road because of the uneven surface. We are worried that the council will get sued or bought into disrepute by failing to deal with the access issues in to a disability school.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Charlton Park Road, Charlton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Vegetation and foliage is overhanging the pavement, 24th September
item.description:
Vegetation and foliage is overhanging the pavement making it very difficult for anyone to walk along and particularly for a wheelchair user to get along it in their wheelchair. The road is a quiet access road and an individual in their wheelchair needs to get off the pavement into the road to transfer into a vehicle so would also benefit from a dropped kerb at this location.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Nunnington Close, Mottingham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavement at the corner of Victoria Road and Kilburn High Road, in front of Santander Bank (traffic lights), 24th September
item.description:
I am writing to report an accident caused by an uneven pavement at the corner of Victoria Road and Kilburn High Road, in front of Santander Bank (traffic lights), which resulted in a broken ankle on 12/06/25 around 7:00 AM. Since the accident, my mobility has been severely affected. I have been unable to walk properly and have had to use a boot and crutches. We are now in the third month, and my ankle is still swollen, and I am unable to put full pressure on my left foot. Additionally, since the accident, I have not been able to go outside for the whole summer and have been in constant pain. The corner remains unchanged and unresolved since my accident. To my knowledge, there are no records indicating that the uneven pavement has been repaired. I would appreciate it if this matter could be investigated promptly to prevent further incidents and to discuss any steps regarding compensation for the injury and ongoing difficulties.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 131-135, Kilburn High Road, Kilburn, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken Record, 24th September
item.description:
I think the photos speak for themselves. I am not sure why me and my neighbours have to request this mess to be cleaned up, constantly. There is clearly an ongoing problem with this tree. Please send someone to remove the debris. Had you have pruned this tree when I asked months back the fruit fall would have been much less and not such an issue. Hopefully the roots will start to damage Thames Waters drains and you will have to remove it!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Haywood Road, Widmore, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Union Jack flags placed on all lamposts on Duchess and Hallam St, 24th September
item.description:
Union Jack flags on lampposts. These should not be here as associated with recent far right protests. Westminster should not be seen to be permitting displays associated with this.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Duchess Street, Fitzrovia, Camden Town, City of Westminster
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish left for five days and building, 24th September
item.description:
This is the fire exit of Nikki's bar at 1, Hoxton Street. It has been left like this since Saturday night nothing collected. Blocking fire exit. Rubbish is building on top of it. I have contacted the bar but got no reply.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Hoxton Square, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large Union flag and several smaller St George's flags on lamppost., 24th September

item.title: Paving near to the approach up to the station at Sidcup, 24th September
item.description:
A few days ago something heavy seems to have caused part of the paving to collapse as it ran over the area possibly while cleaning. It could now be a trip hazard for someone who has not got good eyesight.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Station Road, Longlands, London
